don't preface your question, or ask to ask, just ask your question already
you could be having a number of problems.
it could be that Ubuntu is stressing your system in ways Windows does not, and you've got a hardware problem that Ubuntu has uncovered.  This is pure conjecture.
you may want to run a benchmarking or stress testing tool to see if your system can handle it.  I suggest mprime.
I had a problem with an old computer randomly hard locking (in Windows and in Linux), and mprime led me to believe the problem was with the memory controller on the motherboard.
does it freeze when you view Flash movies in your browser?
